Legal_Issue: Reasonableness of the Refugee Protection Division's decision
Credibility_Assessment: Applicant's testimony found evasive; credibility concerns raised
Evidence_Type: Personal testimony, travel history, asylum behavior
Legal_Provision: Section 96 and Section 97 of IRPA (refugee definition)
Basis_of_Claim: Fear of persecution by armed gang in Haiti
Key_Factor_in_Determination: Credibility, inconsistent behavior (delayed departure, return trips, no prior asylum claim)
Regulation_Cited: IRPR Section 101(1) - Basis for refugee claim assessment
Application_Factor: Subjective fear of persecution, objective basis for fear
Decision_Review_Issue: Was the tribunal's rejection of the claim reasonable?
Governing_Rule_or_Provision: IRPA Section 101(1), principles of procedural fairness
Cause_of_Refusal: Lack of credibility, implausible subjective fear, inconsistent conduct
Evidentiary_Issues: Inconsistencies in testimony, lack of corroborating evidence
Credibility_Issues: Evasive answers, delayed flight, return visits to Haiti, no asylum claim in U.S.
Legal_Defense_or_Challenge: Challenge based on reasonableness of credibility assessment
